meanings.definition: To give a brief summary of something.
meanings.sent1: I need to synopsize this long book for my book report.
meanings.sent2: Can you synopsize the movie for me? I don't have time to watch the whole thing.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked us to synopsize the entire lesson in just one sentence!
meanings.sent4: She can synopsize a complex topic in just a few words, like a magician with a trick.
meanings.sent5: His ability to synopsize information quickly made him a valuable asset in the meeting.

meanings.definition: A brief summary or outline of a text or speech.
meanings.sent1: I wrote a synopsize of the article to help me remember the key points.
meanings.sent2: The synopsize at the beginning of the chapter gave me a good overview of what to expect.
meanings.sent3: The comedian gave a hilarious synopsize of the movie plot that had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like a powerful synopsize of the entire conference, leaving everyone inspired.
meanings.sent5: The infographic provided a visual synopsize of the research findings, making it easy to understand.
